main event: A bluish-green object was sighted near Maxwell, Texas on July 22, 1952, climbing rapidly from 5,000 feet to 14,000 feet, then hovering and descending at an extremely fast speed.
interesting points: The object was reported by four air police and a staff sergeant from the air inspector's office.
The object changed color to red as it descended.
The object hovered for one minute.
A similar object was observed near Uvalde, Texas on the same day, described as pulsing and rotating, and climbing higher while moving behind a cloud.
The flight characteristics and duration of the object did not match that of a meteor, indicating insufficient information for a proper analysis.
sighted object: bluish-green object that changed color to red
